Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Ruse \Ruse\, n. [F., fr. OF. re["u]ser, rehuser, to turn aside, to shuffle, retreat, fr. L. recusare to refuse; pref. re- again + causa cause. See {Cause}, and cf. {Recusant}.] An artifice; trick; stratagem; wile; fraud; deceit. [1913 Webster]
{Ruse de guerre}[F.], a stratagem of war. [1913 Webster]
ruse n : a deceptive maneuver (especially to avoid capture) [syn: {artifice}]
